info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 8:30PM CDT until April 10 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama...
Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Pickens and Sumter Counties.
Tombigbee River At Gainesville Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Marengo and Sumter Counties.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama...
Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam affecting Hale, Greene, Marengo and Sumter Counties.
.Heavy rain tomorrow is expected to cause flooding on the Tombigbee River.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bevill Lock and Dam.
* WHEN...From late Sunday night to late Thursday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 110.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Monday morning to a crest of 126.6 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
&&
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT TO LATE THURSDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Greene, AL; Pickens, AL; Sumter, AL
